count.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to calculate the total number of things or people in a group
count.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I was amazed at the number of plants – I counted 147.
Count up how many ticks are in each box.
count.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to say numbers in order, one by one or in groups
count.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: It’s quicker to count by tens  (=saying 10,20,30 ...).
Sarah can count up to five now.
count.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to be allowed or accepted, or to allow or accept something, according to a standard, set of ideas, or set of rules
count.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: A linesman had his flag up so the kick did not count.
Locally produced sales by American firms in Japan do not count as exports.
Today’s session is counted as training, so you will get paid.
Results from the two rounds count towards championship points.
count.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to include someone or something in a total
count.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: There are more than two thousand of us, not counting the crew.
I count Jules and Ady among my closest friends.
count.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to consider someone or something in a particular way
count.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: You should count yourself lucky that you weren’t hurt.
I don’t count him as a friend anymore.
count.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: His overseas results count for nothing.
His promises don’t count for much.
count.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the process of counting, or the total that you get when you count things
count.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Hold your breath for a count of ten.
count.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a measurement that shows how much of a substance is present in a place, area etc that is being examined
count.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The pollen count is high today.
count.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: one of the crimes that someone is charged with
count.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Davis was found not guilty on all counts.
He was charged with two counts of theft.
count.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a European nobleman with a high rank
count.translation[1].note_box[0].section: I made a rough count of the houses in the street.
According to my quick count, there were 15.
Make sure you do a head count before the children get back on the bus.
Your computer can do an automatic word count.
We went to the main road at 9 am to begin our traffic count.
I looked at the report and did a quick page count.
